subject: Photography
title: Textures and Surfaces
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Textures and Surfaces.

hook.text: Rough bark. Smooth glass. Cracked paint. Your eyes can feel texture in a photograph even without touching it.

buildup.text: Texture photography captures the tactile quality of surfaces â€” making viewers imagine how something would feel.

discovery.text: Side lighting is the key to texture. Light raking across a surface at a low angle reveals every bump and groove.

twist.text: Smooth textures calm the viewer. Rough textures create energy. Contrasting textures in one image add visual tension.

climax.text: Every surface tells a story â€” age, weather, use, material. Texture is the fingerprint of an object's history.

punchline.text: You can feel a photograph if the texture is right.

quiz.question: What lighting technique best reveals texture in photography?
options: Side lighting at a low angle that rakes across the surface
